Method Detail



    




    PersistenceInterface::delete
    


    
delete(
array
$primaryKey );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $primaryKey
    
		
    an array containing keys as the names of primary columns in                                         database and the value correspondant to it,                                         eg:- $primaryKey = array('Id' => 'AaoObBC'),                                          where Id is the pk column and AaoObBC is the value of it.
    
			
    Returns
    
		
    the integer containing the number of rows affected after the delete                                         operation, minimum value of this int can be zero.
    

    Remarks
    

    deletes the database by primary key condition supplied in the parameter.
    
	
    access
    
		
    public
    
	
    [ Top ]
    

    



    PersistenceInterface::getAll
    


    
getAll(
[string
$columnNames = '*'], [int
$limitx = null], [int
$limity = null] );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $columnNames
    
		
    the string representing the column names to select from table.
    
			
    $limitx
    
		
    an integer representing the start limit of SQL.
    
			
    $limity
    
		
    an integer representing the end limit of SQL.
    
			
    Returns
    
		
    the array containing user objects from the user table,                                         where each feild is the datamember of the object, null in case                                         of no results.
    

    Remarks
    

    gets all the users from table without any condition to follow.
    
	
    access
    
		
    public
    
	
    [ Top ]
    

    



    PersistenceInterface::getByCriteria
    


    
getByCriteria(
array
$criteria, [int
$limitx = null], [int
$limity = null], [string
$columnNames = null] );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $criteria
    
		
    an array containing keys as the names of table columns or names                                         with a condition (i.e. either 'id' or 'id <') from the                                         database and the value correspondant to it, or it can be a                                         where clause string of SQL,                                         eg:- $criteria = array('Id' => 'AaoObBC');, or it can be like                                         eg:- $criteria = 'Id=\'AaoObBC\' OR something=\'value\'';                                         by default criteria works on AND method of SQL.
    
			
    $limitx
    
		
    an integer representing the start limit of SQL.
    
			
    $limity
    
		
    an integer representing the end limit of SQL.
    
			
    $columnNames
    
		
    the string representing the column names to select from table,                                         null to select all.
    
			
    Returns
    
		
    the array containing user objects from the user table,                                         where each feild is the datamember of the object, null in case                                         of no results.
    

    Remarks
    

    gets all the users from table which fulfills the criteria supplied by parameter.
    
	
    access
    
		
    public
    
	
    [ Top ]
    

    



    PersistenceInterface::getByPrimaryKey
    


    
getByPrimaryKey(
array
$primaryKey, [int
$limitx = null], [int
$limity = null], [string
$columnNames = null] );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $primaryKey
    
		
    an array containing keys as the names of primary columns in                                         database and the value correspondant to it,                                         eg:- $primaryKey = array('Id' => 'AaoObBC'),                                          where Id is the pk column and AaoObBC is the value of it.
    
			
    $limitx
    
		
    an integer representing the start limit of SQL.
    
			
    $limity
    
		
    an integer representing the end limit of SQL.
    
			
    $columnNames
    
		
    the string representing the column names to select from table,                                         null to select all.
    
			
    Returns
    
		
    the array containing single user object from the user table,                                         where each feild is the datamember of the object, null in case                                         of no results.
    

    Remarks
    

    gets user from table which fulfills the primary key condition supplied by parameter.
    
	
    access
    
		
    public
    
	
    [ Top ]
    

    



    PersistenceInterface::insert
    


    
insert(
array
$object );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $object
    
		
    the array containing all the feild to be inserted, with primary key(s),                                         as a must index.                                         eg:- $object = array (                                                         'id' => 24,                                                         'name' => 'Amir Ali',                                                         'dob' => '15-April-1989'                                                         );                                         in the above example id is the primary key, method would insert the                                         record with id = 24.
    
			
    Returns
    
		
    the integer would contain the last inserted id of database if insert is                                         sucessful, else a zero valued integer is returned.
    

    Remarks
    

    inserts a new record int the database by primary key condition supplied in the array of object by parameter,  if any previous record is already present with the same primary key insert operation fails.
    
	
    access
    
		
    public
    
	
    [ Top ]
    

    



    PersistenceInterface::update
    


    
update(
array
$object );

    

	

		
    Parameters
    
			
    $object
    
		
    the array containing all the feild to be updated, with primary key(s),                                         as a must index.                                         eg:- $object = array (                                                         'id' => 24,                                                         'name' => 'Amir Ali',                                                         'dob' => '15-April-1989'                                                         );                                         in the above example id is the primary key, method would update the                                         record with id = 24.
    
			
    Returns
    
		
    the integer containing the number of rows affected after the update                                         operation, minimum value of this int can be zero.
    

    Remarks
    

    updates the database by primary key condition supplied in the array of object by parameter.
    
	
    access
    
		
    public
    
	
    [ Top ]
